content.html: failed drone build

content.raw:
I just updated the drone build to use cmake 2.8.11.2, and it fails, since `target_compile_options` requires cmake 2.8.12

* https://cmake.org/cmake/help/v2.8.12/cmake.html#command:target_compile_options
* https://cmake.org/cmake/help/v2.8.11/cmake.html doesn't have the command

we should probably require 2.8.12 instead
content.html:
I just updated the drone build to use cmake 2.8.11.2, and it fails, since target_compile_options requires cmake 2.8.12

  • https://cmake.org/cmake/help/v2.8.12/cmake.html#command:target_compile_options
  • https://cmake.org/cmake/help/v2.8.11/cmake.html doesn't have the command

we should probably require 2.8.12 instead

update.description:
Change of the CMake infrastructure to export a relocatable CMake package.

The library is now used in downstream packages as an imported target
(see https://cmake.org/cmake/help/v3.0/manual/cmake-buildsystem.7.html#imported-targets).

This means there is now no need to manually set include directories, link directories and
compiler flags in packages using ignition-math, but it is sufficient to just link
to the imported target, as it is possible to see in the examples directory.

@\_jrivero\_  I don't know if you are already preparing a more systematic migration to relocatable cmake packages, for example starting from ign-seed or ign-cmake . In that case feel free to decline this pull request.
update.title: Migrate to relocatable CMake package

content.raw: That is a good point. When using C++11 we need users to install a differentl toolchain in Ubuntu Precise (cmake 2.8.7) which  makes the whole thing not ready to work out of the box there. New versions of sdformat and gazebo are not being released to Precise so I'm ok with dropping Precise from now on and backport the change to current ign-math2 branch.
content.html: That is a good point. When using C++11 we need users to install a differentl toolchain in Ubuntu Precise (cmake 2.8.7) which makes the whole thing not ready to work out of the box there. New versions of sdformat and gazebo are not being released to Precise so I'm ok with dropping Precise from now on and backport the change to current ign-math2 branch.

content.raw: I guess the only big requirement is CMake 2.8.11 , and I don't know which version of Ubuntu you have to support in `ign-math2` .
content.html: I guess the only big requirement is CMake 2.8.11 , and I don't know which version of Ubuntu you have to support in ign-math2 .

content.raw:
yes, thanks @traversaro !!!

Is this backportable?
content.html:
yes, thanks @traversaro !!!

Is this backportable?

content.raw:
Sorry for arriving a bit late to the party.

@traversaro yes, the creation of a common package for all our cmake stuff is in my list of priorities, in the top of my letter to Santa Claus. ign-cmake-modules (ala ros-cmake-modules) would be really nice to have. Something still to happen.

The whole PR looks good to me. I've been able to use it to install into /usr and compile sdformat without a problem. Install it into /tmp/foo and compile sdformat via CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH. And after installing it in /tmp/foo move it to /tmp/snake and sdformat still compiles without problems.

So green light, really nice contribution Silvio, thanks very much.
content.html:
Sorry for arriving a bit late to the party.

@traversaro yes, the creation of a common package for all our cmake stuff is in my list of priorities, in the top of my letter to Santa Claus. ign-cmake-modules (ala ros-cmake-modules) would be really nice to have. Something still to happen.

The whole PR looks good to me. I've been able to use it to install into /usr and compile sdformat without a problem. Install it into /tmp/foo and compile sdformat via CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH. And after installing it in /tmp/foo move it to /tmp/snake and sdformat still compiles without problems.

So green light, really nice contribution Silvio, thanks very much.

content.raw:
My fault, I had used a feature introduced in CMake 3.0 
( EXPORT mode of export command, see https://cmake.org/cmake/help/v3.0/release/3.0.0.html ).
Fixed in https://bitbucket.org/traversaro/ign-math/commits/933a4526672f7b66c9385269764a049af5bf2a40?at=default by 
using the TARGETS mode of the export command.
content.html: My fault, I had used a feature introduced in CMake 3.0 ( EXPORT mode of export command, see https://cmake.org/cmake/help/v3.0/release/3.0.0.html ). Fixed in https://bitbucket.org/traversaro/ign-math/commits/933a4526672f7b66c9385269764a049af5bf2a40?at=default by using the TARGETS mode of the export command.

update.description:
Change of the CMake infrastructure to export a relocatable CMake package.

The library is now used in downstream packages as an imported target
(see https://cmake.org/cmake/help/v3.0/manual/cmake-buildsystem.7.html#imported-targets).

This means there is now no need to manually set include directories, link directories and
compiler flags in packages using ignition-math, but it is sufficient to just link
to the imported target, as it is possible to see in the examples directory.

@\_jrivero\_  I don't know if you are already preparing a more systematic migration to relocatable cmake packages, for example starting from ign-seed or ign-cmake . In that case feel free to decline this pull request.
update.title: Migrate to relocatable CMake package

content.raw:
Fixed Windows tests in https://bitbucket.org/traversaro/ign-math/commits/93d6151a55aac374bce2406eade99563120ed6f4?at=default . 

Furthermore I generated the -targets.cmake also for the build directory. 

This is convenient on Windows because  if you run cmake from Gui , the build directory will be 
"cached" and subsequent calls in different projects to find_package(ignition-math2 ) will 
find the library in the build directory over the installed one (unless you explicitly set ignition-math2_DIR). 
(See step 5 in https://cmake.org/cmake/help/v3.0/command/find_package.html ).
content.html:
Fixed Windows tests in https://bitbucket.org/traversaro/ign-math/commits/93d6151a55aac374bce2406eade99563120ed6f4?at=default .

Furthermore I generated the -targets.cmake also for the build directory.

This is convenient on Windows because if you run cmake from Gui , the build directory will be "cached" and subsequent calls in different projects to find_package(ignition-math2 ) will find the library in the build directory over the installed one (unless you explicitly set ignition-math2_DIR). (See step 5 in https://cmake.org/cmake/help/v3.0/command/find_package.html ).

content.raw: The answer was easier then I thought: there is no CMake 2.5.x, the version jumped from 2.4 to 2.6 : https://cmake.org/Wiki/CMake_Released_Versions .
content.html: The answer was easier then I thought: there is no CMake 2.5.x, the version jumped from 2.4 to 2.6 : https://cmake.org/Wiki/CMake_Released_Versions .

content.raw:
Good question, it seems an issue in `install(EXPORT ... )`. 

I will check this with our local CMake guru, then perhaps we will try to fix this issue in CMake upstream.
content.html:
Good question, it seems an issue in install(EXPORT ... ).

I will check this with our local CMake guru, then perhaps we will try to fix this issue in CMake upstream.

content.raw:
This logic looks inconsistent to me. What if the user uses CMake 2.5.x?

```
#!CMake

if("${CMAKE_MAJOR_VERSION}.${CMAKE_MINOR_VERSION}" LESS 2.5)
   message(FATAL_ERROR "CMake >= 2.6.0 required")
endif()
cmake_policy(PUSH)
cmake_policy(VERSION 2.6)
```
content.html:
This logic looks inconsistent to me. What if the user uses CMake 2.5.x?

if("${CMAKE_MAJOR_VERSION}.${CMAKE_MINOR_VERSION}" LESS 2.5)
   message(FATAL_ERROR "CMake >= 2.6.0 required")
endif()
cmake_policy(PUSH)
cmake_policy(VERSION 2.6)

content.raw:
Examples of generated files in Ubuntu 14.04 : 

`ignition-math2-config.cmake`
~~~
if (IGNITION-MATH_CONFIG_INCLUDED)
  return()
endif()
set(IGNITION-MATH_CONFIG_INCLUDED TRUE)


####### Expanded from @PACKAGE_INIT@ by configure_package_config_file() #######
####### Any changes to this file will be overwritten by the next CMake run ####
####### The input file was ignition-math-config.cmake.in                            ########

get_filename_component(PACKAGE_PREFIX_DIR "${CMAKE_CURRENT_LIST_DIR}/../../../../" ABSOLUTE)

macro(set_and_check _var _file)
  set(${_var} "${_file}")
  if(NOT EXISTS "${_file}")
    message(FATAL_ERROR "File or directory ${_file} referenced by variable ${_var} does not exist !")
  endif()
endmacro()

macro(check_required_components _NAME)
  foreach(comp ${${_NAME}_FIND_COMPONENTS})
    if(NOT ${_NAME}_${comp}_FOUND)
      if(${_NAME}_FIND_REQUIRED_${comp})
        set(${_NAME}_FOUND FALSE)
      endif()
    endif()
  endforeach()
endmacro()

####################################################################################

if(NOT TARGET ignition-math2)
  include("${CMAKE_CURRENT_LIST_DIR}/ignition-math2-targets.cmake")
endif()

# Compatibility
set(IGNITION-MATH_LIBRARIES ignition-math2)
set(IGNITION-MATH_INCLUDE_DIRS "${PACKAGE_PREFIX_DIR}/include/ignition/math2")
set(IGNITION-MATH_LIBRARY_DIRS "${PACKAGE_PREFIX_DIR}/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu")
~~~

`ignition-math2-targets.cmake` :
~~~
# Generated by CMake 2.8.12.2

if("${CMAKE_MAJOR_VERSION}.${CMAKE_MINOR_VERSION}" LESS 2.5)
   message(FATAL_ERROR "CMake >= 2.6.0 required")
endif()
cmake_policy(PUSH)
cmake_policy(VERSION 2.6)
#----------------------------------------------------------------
# Generated CMake target import file.
#----------------------------------------------------------------

# Commands may need to know the format version.
set(CMAKE_IMPORT_FILE_VERSION 1)

# Protect against multiple inclusion, which would fail when already imported targets are added once more.
set(_targetsDefined)
set(_targetsNotDefined)
set(_expectedTargets)
foreach(_expectedTarget ignition-math2)
  list(APPEND _expectedTargets ${_expectedTarget})
  if(NOT TARGET ${_expectedTarget})
    list(APPEND _targetsNotDefined ${_expectedTarget})
  endif()
  if(TARGET ${_expectedTarget})
    list(APPEND _targetsDefined ${_expectedTarget})
  endif()
endforeach()
if("${_targetsDefined}" STREQUAL "${_expectedTargets}")
  set(CMAKE_IMPORT_FILE_VERSION)
  cmake_policy(POP)
  return()
endif()
if(NOT "${_targetsDefined}" STREQUAL "")
  message(FATAL_ERROR "Some (but not all) targets in this export set were already defined.\nTargets Defined: ${_targetsDefined}\nTargets not yet defined: ${_targetsNotDefined}\n")
endif()
unset(_targetsDefined)
unset(_targetsNotDefined)
unset(_expectedTargets)


# Compute the installation prefix relative to this file.
get_filename_component(_IMPORT_PREFIX "${CMAKE_CURRENT_LIST_FILE}" PATH)
get_filename_component(_IMPORT_PREFIX "${_IMPORT_PREFIX}" PATH)
get_filename_component(_IMPORT_PREFIX "${_IMPORT_PREFIX}" PATH)
get_filename_component(_IMPORT_PREFIX "${_IMPORT_PREFIX}" PATH)
get_filename_component(_IMPORT_PREFIX "${_IMPORT_PREFIX}" PATH)

# Create imported target ignition-math2
add_library(ignition-math2 SHARED IMPORTED)

set_target_properties(ignition-math2 PROPERTIES
  INTERFACE_COMPILE_OPTIONS "-std=c++11"
  INTERFACE_INCLUDE_DIRECTORIES "${_IMPORT_PREFIX}/include/ignition/math2"
)

# Load information for each installed configuration.
get_filename_component(_DIR "${CMAKE_CURRENT_LIST_FILE}" PATH)
file(GLOB CONFIG_FILES "${_DIR}/ignition-math2-targets-*.cmake")
foreach(f ${CONFIG_FILES})
  include(${f})
endforeach()

# Cleanup temporary variables.
set(_IMPORT_PREFIX)

# Loop over all imported files and verify that they actually exist
foreach(target ${_IMPORT_CHECK_TARGETS} )
  foreach(file ${_IMPORT_CHECK_FILES_FOR_${target}} )
    if(NOT EXISTS "${file}" )
      message(FATAL_ERROR "The imported target \"${target}\" references the file
   \"${file}\"
but this file does not exist.  Possible reasons include:
* The file was deleted, renamed, or moved to another location.
* An install or uninstall procedure did not complete successfully.
* The installation package was faulty and contained
   \"${CMAKE_CURRENT_LIST_FILE}\"
but not all the files it references.
")
    endif()
  endforeach()
  unset(_IMPORT_CHECK_FILES_FOR_${target})
endforeach()
unset(_IMPORT_CHECK_TARGETS)

# This file does not depend on other imported targets which have
# been exported from the same project but in a separate export set.

# Commands beyond this point should not need to know the version.
set(CMAKE_IMPORT_FILE_VERSION)
cmake_policy(POP)
~~~
content.html:
Examples of generated files in Ubuntu 14.04 :

ignition-math2-config.cmake

if (IGNITION-MATH_CONFIG_INCLUDED)
  return()
endif()
set(IGNITION-MATH_CONFIG_INCLUDED TRUE)


####### Expanded from @PACKAGE_INIT@ by configure_package_config_file() #######
####### Any changes to this file will be overwritten by the next CMake run ####
####### The input file was ignition-math-config.cmake.in                            ########

get_filename_component(PACKAGE_PREFIX_DIR "${CMAKE_CURRENT_LIST_DIR}/../../../../" ABSOLUTE)

macro(set_and_check _var _file)
  set(${_var} "${_file}")
  if(NOT EXISTS "${_file}")
    message(FATAL_ERROR "File or directory ${_file} referenced by variable ${_var} does not exist !")
  endif()
endmacro()

macro(check_required_components _NAME)
  foreach(comp ${${_NAME}_FIND_COMPONENTS})
    if(NOT ${_NAME}_${comp}_FOUND)
      if(${_NAME}_FIND_REQUIRED_${comp})
        set(${_NAME}_FOUND FALSE)
      endif()
    endif()
  endforeach()
endmacro()

####################################################################################

if(NOT TARGET ignition-math2)
  include("${CMAKE_CURRENT_LIST_DIR}/ignition-math2-targets.cmake")
endif()

# Compatibility
set(IGNITION-MATH_LIBRARIES ignition-math2)
set(IGNITION-MATH_INCLUDE_DIRS "${PACKAGE_PREFIX_DIR}/include/ignition/math2")
set(IGNITION-MATH_LIBRARY_DIRS "${PACKAGE_PREFIX_DIR}/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu")

ignition-math2-targets.cmake :

# Generated by CMake 2.8.12.2

if("${CMAKE_MAJOR_VERSION}.${CMAKE_MINOR_VERSION}" LESS 2.5)
   message(FATAL_ERROR "CMake >= 2.6.0 required")
endif()
cmake_policy(PUSH)
cmake_policy(VERSION 2.6)
#----------------------------------------------------------------
# Generated CMake target import file.
#----------------------------------------------------------------

# Commands may need to know the format version.
set(CMAKE_IMPORT_FILE_VERSION 1)

# Protect against multiple inclusion, which would fail when already imported targets are added once more.
set(_targetsDefined)
set(_targetsNotDefined)
set(_expectedTargets)
foreach(_expectedTarget ignition-math2)
  list(APPEND _expectedTargets ${_expectedTarget})
  if(NOT TARGET ${_expectedTarget})
    list(APPEND _targetsNotDefined ${_expectedTarget})
  endif()
  if(TARGET ${_expectedTarget})
    list(APPEND _targetsDefined ${_expectedTarget})
  endif()
endforeach()
if("${_targetsDefined}" STREQUAL "${_expectedTargets}")
  set(CMAKE_IMPORT_FILE_VERSION)
  cmake_policy(POP)
  return()
endif()
if(NOT "${_targetsDefined}" STREQUAL "")
  message(FATAL_ERROR "Some (but not all) targets in this export set were already defined.\nTargets Defined: ${_targetsDefined}\nTargets not yet defined: ${_targetsNotDefined}\n")
endif()
unset(_targetsDefined)
unset(_targetsNotDefined)
unset(_expectedTargets)


# Compute the installation prefix relative to this file.
get_filename_component(_IMPORT_PREFIX "${CMAKE_CURRENT_LIST_FILE}" PATH)
get_filename_component(_IMPORT_PREFIX "${_IMPORT_PREFIX}" PATH)
get_filename_component(_IMPORT_PREFIX "${_IMPORT_PREFIX}" PATH)
get_filename_component(_IMPORT_PREFIX "${_IMPORT_PREFIX}" PATH)
get_filename_component(_IMPORT_PREFIX "${_IMPORT_PREFIX}" PATH)

# Create imported target ignition-math2
add_library(ignition-math2 SHARED IMPORTED)

set_target_properties(ignition-math2 PROPERTIES
  INTERFACE_COMPILE_OPTIONS "-std=c++11"
  INTERFACE_INCLUDE_DIRECTORIES "${_IMPORT_PREFIX}/include/ignition/math2"
)

# Load information for each installed configuration.
get_filename_component(_DIR "${CMAKE_CURRENT_LIST_FILE}" PATH)
file(GLOB CONFIG_FILES "${_DIR}/ignition-math2-targets-*.cmake")
foreach(f ${CONFIG_FILES})
  include(${f})
endforeach()

# Cleanup temporary variables.
set(_IMPORT_PREFIX)

# Loop over all imported files and verify that they actually exist
foreach(target ${_IMPORT_CHECK_TARGETS} )
  foreach(file ${_IMPORT_CHECK_FILES_FOR_${target}} )
    if(NOT EXISTS "${file}" )
      message(FATAL_ERROR "The imported target \"${target}\" references the file
   \"${file}\"
but this file does not exist.  Possible reasons include:
* The file was deleted, renamed, or moved to another location.
* An install or uninstall procedure did not complete successfully.
* The installation package was faulty and contained
   \"${CMAKE_CURRENT_LIST_FILE}\"
but not all the files it references.
")
    endif()
  endforeach()
  unset(_IMPORT_CHECK_FILES_FOR_${target})
endforeach()
unset(_IMPORT_CHECK_TARGETS)

# This file does not depend on other imported targets which have
# been exported from the same project but in a separate export set.

# Commands beyond this point should not need to know the version.
set(CMAKE_IMPORT_FILE_VERSION)
cmake_policy(POP)

update.description:
Change of the CMake infrastructure to export a relocatable CMake package.

The library is now used in downstream packages as an imported target
(see https://cmake.org/cmake/help/v3.0/manual/cmake-buildsystem.7.html#imported-targets).

This means there is now no need to manually set include directories, link directories and
compiler flags in packages using ignition-math, but it is sufficient to just link
to the imported target, as it is possible to see in the examples directory.

@\_jrivero\_  I don't know if you are already preparing a more systematic migration to relocatable cmake packages, for example starting from ign-seed or ign-cmake . In that case feel free to decline this pull request.
